name: Kali cyanatum
Relationship: Compare: PLATIN.; STANN.; CEDRON; MEZER.; MUR-AC.
Modalities: Worse: from four am to four pm

Respiratory: Cough prevents sleep; respiration weak; cannot take deep breath
Mouth: Power of speech lost but intelligence intact
Ulcer of tongue, with indurated edges
Face: Pain in orbital and supramaxillary region, with screaming and loss of consciousness
Severe neuralgia in temporal region, recurring daily at same hour

details: Sudden sinking sensation. Cancer of tongue and agonizing neuralgia have been benefited by this drug. Sick headache; sciatica; epilepsy.
